[{"id":"O-14","entityId":"2-464","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"O"},{"name":"summary","value":"Batch-update roles on authorization service"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Deleted User"},{"name":"created","value":"1574242201905"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"14"},{"name":"description","value":"

Currently each micro-service is responsible for roles registration and deletion logic.
It seems better to move all the roles management to authorization-service to keep roles management in single place.

As improvement we should:

  • add endpoint which will accept array of roles to register
  • authentication-service will decide which roles to delete/add based on incoming roles array.
  • update existing micro-services which already do roles registration and management
"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Vitalii Dmytruk"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"system_user@a4wQ6h27MH"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"vdmytruk"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1582630383336"},{"name":"Type","value":["User Story"],"valueId":["User Story"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"vdmytruk","fullName":"Vitalii Dmytruk"}]}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"O-6","entityId":"2-448","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"O"},{"name":"summary","value":"Default roles are not added to users if user already exist"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Oleksandr Cheban"},{"name":"created","value":"1574101416671"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"6"},{"name":"description","value":"

Environment state:

  • users table exist and is populated with users
  • there are no records in user_roles table (not sure it influences this defect)

Steps to reproduce:

  1. add new roles with default flag
  2. check user_roles table

Actual result:
there are no any records in user_roles table

Expected result:
for each user should be created record in user_roles
